biography.value:
To forestall the inevitable, some storm giant;storm giants approaching the end of their natural life spans seek an escape from death. They plumb the depths of their powerful connection to the elements and disperse themselves into nature, transforming into semiconscious storms. The blizzard that rages unendingly around a mountain peak, the vortex that swirls around a remote island, or the thunderstorm that howls ceaselessly up and down a rugged coastline could, in fact, be the undying form of a storm giant clinging to existence.

A storm giant quintessent sheds their armor and weapons but gains the power to form makeshift weapons out of thin air. When the giant has no further use of these elemental weapons, or when the giant dies, the weapons disappear.

A storm giant quintessent can revert to their true giant form temporarily and can maintain that form long enough for the giant to communicate with a mortal, carry out a short task, or defend their home against aggressors.

source.book: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse

description.value:
The &Reference[giant]{giant} makes two &Reference[lightning]{Lightning} Sword attacks, or it uses Wind Javelin twice.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

source.book: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse

description.value:
Melee Weapon Attack: +14 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. Hit: [[/damage 9d6 + @mod type=lightning average=true]] damage.

The [[lookup @name]] attacks with its [[lookup @item.name]].

source.book: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse

description.value:
The &Reference[giant]{giant} coalesces wind into a javelin-like form and hurls it at a creature it can see within 600 feet of it. The javelin deals [[/damage 3d6 + 9 type=force average=true]] damage to the target, striking unerringly. The javelin disappears after it hits.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

source.book: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse

description.value:
Lair Actions

A storm &Reference[giant]{giant} quintessent can use lair actions in &Reference[giant]{giant} form and while transformed into a storm. On initiative count 20 (losing initiative ties), the &Reference[giant]{giant} can take one of the following lair actions; the &Reference[giant]{giant} can’t take the same lair action two rounds in a row:

Deafening Boom. The &Reference[giant]{giant} creates a thunderclap centered on a point anywhere in their lair. Each creature within 20 feet of that point must succeed on a [[/save con 18 format=long]] or be &Reference[deafened]{deafened} until the end of its next turn.

Fog. The &Reference[giant]{giant} creates a 20-foot-radius &Reference[sphere]{sphere} of fog (or murky water if within water) centered on a point anywhere in its lair. The &Reference[sphere]{sphere} spreads around corners, and its area is heavily obscured. The fog lasts until the &Reference[giant]{giant} disperses it (no action required), and it can’t be dispersed by wind.

Gale. The &Reference[giant]{giant} creates a 60-foot-long, 10-foot-wide &Reference[line]{line} of strong wind (or strong current within water) originating from a point anywhere in its lair. Each creature in that &Reference[line]{line} must succeed on a [[/save str 18 format=long]] or be pushed 15 feet in the direction the wind is blowing. The gust disperses gas or vapor, and it extinguishes candles, torches, and similar unprotected flames in its area. Protected flames, such as those of lanterns, have a 50 percent chance of being extinguished.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

source.book: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse

description.value:
Regional Effects

The region containing a storm &Reference[giant]{giant} quintessent’s lair is warped by the giant’s presence, which creates one or more of the following effects:

Downpour. Rain, snow, or blowing dust or sand (whichever is most appropriate) is constant within 1 mile of the lair. Rain causes rivers and streams to fill or overflow their banks; snow, dust, or sand forms deep drifts or dunes.

&Reference[lightning]{Lightning}. Flashes of &Reference[lightning]{lightning} and peals of &Reference[thunder]{thunder} are continual, day and night, within 5 miles of the lair.

Winds. High wind blows within 1 mile of the lair, making it impossible to light a &Reference[fire]{fire} unless the location where the &Reference[fire]{fire} is lit is protected from the wind.

If the &Reference[giant]{giant} dies, the &Reference[lightning]{lightning}, &Reference[thunder]{thunder}, and high wind regional effects end immediately. Rain, snow, and blowing dust abate gradually within 1d8 days.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

source.book: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse

description.value:
A Quintessent’s Lair

A storm &Reference[giant]{giant} quintessent has no need for castles or dungeon lairs. Their lair is usually a secluded region or prominent geographic feature, such as a mountain peak, a great waterfall, a remote island, a fog-shrouded loch, a beautiful coral reef, or a windswept desert bluff. The storm in which the &Reference[giant]{giant} lives could be a blizzard, a typhoon, a thunderstorm, or a sandstorm, as befits the environment.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

source.book: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse

description.value:
The &Reference[giant]{giant} can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action option can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature’s turn. The &Reference[giant]{giant} regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.

Gust. The &Reference[giant]{giant} targets a creature it can see within 60 feet of it and creates a magical gust of wind around the target, who must succeed on a [[/save str 18 format=long]] or be moved up to 20 feet in any horizontal direction the &Reference[giant]{giant} chooses.

Thunderbolt (Costs 2 Actions). The &Reference[giant]{giant} hurls a thunderbolt at a creature it can see within 600 feet of it. The target must make a [[/save dex 18 format=long]], taking [[/damage 4d10 type=thunder average=true]] damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

One with the Storm (Costs 3 Actions). The &Reference[giant]{giant} vanishes, dispersing itself into the storm surrounding its lair. The &Reference[giant]{giant} can end this effect at the start of any of its turns, becoming a &Reference[giant]{giant} once more and appearing in any location it chooses within its lair. While dispersed, the &Reference[giant]{giant} can’t take any actions other than lair actions, and it can’t be targeted by attacks, spells, or other effects. The &Reference[giant]{giant} can’t use this ability outside its lair, nor can it use this ability if another creature is using a control weather spell or similar magic to quell the storm.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

source.book: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse
